intro: Verbascum belasitzae, commonly known as the Belasitza mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
